projects.description: List of Tact projects with respective compilation options. Each .tact file represents its own Tact project.

name.description:
Name of the project. All generated files are prefixed with it.

In Blueprint, `name` refers to the name of the contract itself.

path.description:
Path to the project's Tact file. You can only specify one Tact file per project.

In Blueprint, `path` is superseded by the `target` field in `wrappers/ContractName.compile.ts`.

output.description:
Path to the directory where all generated files will be placed.

In Blueprint, `output` is not used and all generated files are always placed in `build/ProjectName/`.

options.description:
Compilation options for the project.

In Blueprint, they act as default unless modified in `wrappers/ContractName.compile.ts`.

debug.description:
False by default. If set to true, enables debug output of a contract and allows usage of `dump()` function, which is useful for debugging purposes. With this option enabled, the contract will report that it was compiled in debug mode using the supported_interfaces method.

Read more on debugging Tact code: https://docs.tact-lang.org/book/debug.

masterchain.description:
False by default. If set to true, enables masterchain support.

Read more about masterchain: https://docs.tact-lang.org/book/masterchain.

external.description:
False by default. If set to true, enables support of external message receivers.

Read more about external message receivers: https://docs.tact-lang.org/book/external.

ipfsAbiGetter.description:
False by default. If set to true, enables generation of a getter with IPFS links describing the contract's ABI.

Read more about IPFS ABI links: https://docs.tact-lang.org/ref/evolution/OTP-003.

interfacesGetter.description:
False by default. If set to true, enables generation of a getter the information on the interfaces provided by the contract.

Read more about supported interfaces: https://docs.tact-lang.org/ref/evolution/OTP-001.

skipTactOptimizationPhase.description: False by default. If set to true, skips the Tact code optimization phase.

dumpCodeBeforeAndAfterTactOptimizationPh.description: False by default. If set to true, dumps the code produced before and after the Tact code optimization phase.

experimental.description: Experimental options that might be removed in the future. Use with caution!

inline.description: False by default. If set to true, enables inlining of all functions in contracts. This can reduce gas usage at the cost of bigger contracts.

mode.title: Compilation mode of the project. In Blueprint, it's always set to `full` and cannot be overwritten.
mode.description:
Set to `full` by default, which runs the whole pipeline of the compilation and emits FunC code, BoC, and various utility files, including wrappers for TypeScript.
If set to `fullWithDecompilation`, does full compilation and also decompiles produced binary code in the BoC format.
If set to `funcOnly`, only outputs intermediate FunC code, preventing further compilation.
If set to `checkOnly`, only performs syntax and type checking, preventing further compilation.
